alert.note: Alert for Clarendon; Southeastern Orangeburg; Sumter (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 09 at 9:43PM EST by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Clarendon, central Sumter and southeastern Orangeburg Counties through 1015 PM EST... At 942 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Alcolu to near Summerton to near Indian Field. Movement was east at 45 mph. ...Boaters on Lake Marion Should Seek Safe Harbor... HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Manning, South Sumter, Holly Hill, Summerton, Alcolu, Woods Bay State Park, Santee Cooper Regional Airport, Turbeville, Eutawville, Paxville, Vance, Rocks Pond Campground and Marina, Brogdon, Foreston, Eautaw Springs, Indian Bluff Recreation Park, Gable, Davis Station, Blounts Landing and Mill Creek Marina and Campground. This includes the following highways... Interstate 26 between mile markers 167 and 169. Interstate 95 between mile markers 85 and 95, and between mile markers 105 and 139. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
